website_summaries.verdict: Like the D80 before it, the Nikon D90 delivers an excellent dSLR for the money.
pros: solid, well-constructed body with nice viewfinder

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I've been very pleased with my purchase of another Nikon D90. The camera arrived five days early and the camera was very well packed and was very well padded for shipment. I currently own a Nikon D90 and wanted another one for my wife to replace her still well functioning Nikon D70s. I've found the Nikon D 90 to be a real workhorse for me-everything we need and it has great functionality and quite well-made. Though the camera was listed as being "used", but in "like new condition", & really is in"like new" condition! I Look forward to doing business again with Phototronics
customer_reviews.author: John R

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I paid for!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to upgrade to a "newer" camera from my D70 to a D90, because I am not ready for the advanced models. Luckily I found a "like new" D90. I'm very pleased with this purchase, because it has hardly been used. No scratches, dents, or defects. It is truly in perfect condition! As for the ease of use, it takes clearer pictures than my D70 for the price I paid. It's very similar to my first camera, with a few more features. The megapixels doubled, so my photos are even better quality. So far, I love this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Simply the BEST Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera has been my baby since I bought it years ago. Should have reviewed it sooner, but I’ve just been enjoying it. In the years I’ve had it, I’ve not had one issue. It’s simply the best.
customer_reviews.author: cnfuhrer

customer_reviews.title: That sent me back to the D90 and I was happy to purchase a refurbished model from KEH for much ...
customer_reviews.text: I’d had my previous D90 taken out of my car by neighborhood hoodlums and replaced it with a D3200. Having used it for a while, I came to find out I couldn’t use the autofocus feature on my 50 mm lense with the D3200. That sent me back to the D90 and I was happy to purchase a refurbished model from KEH for much less than I paid for it New a few years earlier. Ordered on a Monday, product arrived at my doorstep on a Wednesday. I feel very confident in the quality and am a happy customer who will look to KEH first for all my photo and video needs in the future. They’ve got a good operation.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Mortensen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd D90 that I have purchased because I LOVE it! I use it for my Family Event & Portrait business. I have had my 1st one for quite a few years now & I needed something new. When I shopped around, I found the latest & greatest models were very expensive & more technology than I will ever need. So, I decided that since I love my D90 so much, why not just get another one! So, my original D90 is my backup & my new D90 is my regular use system. I have no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: vincent

customer_reviews.title: I am a NIKON fan
customer_reviews.text: This body replaced my D80 which I loved...BUT this definitely was a step if not a quantum leap to perfection. I have been shooting professionally for years doing side jobs as well as just personal, this has been rewarding to say the least. Nikon Added features and best of all Video. All I can say is to watch videos on YouTube which I did, become an educated buyer before you purchase any photo equipment. ALSO very IMPORTANT...make sure the Nikon you buy is for the American Market or the warranty is NO GOOD. They often use the term GREY MARKET. I actually called the seller before I bought just to make sure.
customer_reviews.author: A-Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: I like the camera, but when I first bought it refurbished the shutter was defective and I had to send it to Nikon for repair per warranty. It was so disappointing to not be able to use a camera I had just bought for months due to Nikon's slow repair time. I'm not sure I would buy a refurb Nikon again. Works well now.
customer_reviews.author: Theslowlife

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Except......
customer_reviews.text: Everything about the D90 was perfect except for the fact that when I received it, the serial number tab on the bottom was missing. Al the seller did was apologize. I could not register my nikon for insurance purposes because of that. But other than that, the dslr works perfectly. I will be upgrading in about a year or so but until then, I highly recommend this camera to the beginner, hobbyist, amateur, and the photographer who is ready to transition to the realm of being a professional. Please be sure to visit my website at [...]
customer_reviews.author: Christian Perello

customer_reviews.title: It’s still relevant in 2019
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a cheap camera to carry around and I have no issues whatsoever. I’ve used it for professional work and the only time I wouldn’t use this would be when the lighting isn’t so great, I.e wedding receptions.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy lefeve

customer_reviews.title: My Best Buy yet
customer_reviews.text: It came in perfect condition and in very nice packaging. It comes with a charger, battery, the camera, an 18-105mm lens, an MC-DC2, a lens hood, and a complementary UV filter (I think that’s what it’s called). Really good value and would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hallie

customer_reviews.title: It takes great shots. I wish it had a manual
customer_reviews.text: It takes great shots. I wish it had a manual. Things are really in places I wouldn't think to look and son't seem to be organized well, but maybe once I get used to it it will be easy. I would also like a regular lens. I guess I should have ordered that. It takes great video as well, the sound and video quality is great. I would definitely be looking into having an extra battery. I ran out about halfway through my boyfriend's gig. Lots of video though.
customer_reviews.author: Angi Hillock

customer_reviews.title: Good Mid Level Camera
customer_reviews.text: My wife got this camera for my birthday. At that time it was the best mid-level camera in the market. I am still using it and will continue to use it I am using it mainly for my home photography. It is very handy and fits perfectly in my hand. This is still a very good model to start your photography passion.
customer_reviews.author: NilatS

customer_reviews.title: What perfect DX format DSLR
customer_reviews.text: After researching different cameras offered by Canon and Nikon, I chose the D90. It's proven to be an excellent choice. I bundled it with the 18-105 instead of the smaller lens it comes with. The wide angle lens provides opportunities for some amazing landscape shots. The camera is full of features, one better than the other. Every button is where it should be. The continuous shooting mode on this camera is amazing. There is no comparison with the much more expensive cameras for a frame or two more per second. It's proven to be an excellent motorsport and airshow camera to say the least!
customer_reviews.author: akas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product works as expected Great price!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Product works as expected Great price! Still to this day stellar image quality
customer_reviews.author: Ja

customer_reviews.title: A great SLR camera
customer_reviews.text: Had a burning desire to get a good SLR camera since my old 35 mm became obsolete. Kept dragging my feet hoping that a camera would come out that would allow me to use my old telephoto & close-up lenses and finally realized that was never going to happen. Then came the decision of which brand would be best -- Nikon or Cannon. Chose the Nikon based on their reputation for superior lens making. I'm very happy with the camera and all the features. Should have made the decision long ago as money was wasted on 2 other point & click digital cameras prior to getting the D90.
customer_reviews.author: KenO

customer_reviews.title: Dramatic upgrade from the D80
customer_reviews.text: As, due to finances, am always a generation behind as well as used, I finally got to get a modern sensor. The high ISO performance is incredible. 8-) Live view is VERY handy with all my major neck issues. ISO 1600 is really clean, and, with my Nikkor 50mm 1.8 AF lens, rarely need to go higher. ISO 3200 is actually cleaner than ISO 1600 was on the D80. 8-) Sure, it's not the newest on the block, it's leaps and bounds above the D8-, and finally became affordable used! 8-)
customer_reviews.author: BlueHawK

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Replacing an older D50 camera. I was quite amazed at the condition of this D90. Not a mark on it. Looks to be fresh out of the box. Takes great photos with the use of the lenses i already have.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Baillargeon

customer_reviews.title: After 7+ years, still incredible!
customer_reviews.text: Still love this camera, have no desire for better! Bought Sept 2008, that winter went to a family reunion where one sibling had a D70 and the other a D50. By January, both had the D90! Occasionally, I put on my 70-210 lens from my film Nikon P60 (when I'm going to an airshow, etc). I think I'm at almost 30,000 photos so far (resets each 10,000). Same battery!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly G

customer_reviews.title: High quality and automatic
customer_reviews.text: I loved the range of the zoom (38 mm - 210 mm in my old 35 mm mind). The camera and lens are small and lightweight making it very easy to carry around to places you might not take your large camera bag and equipment, yet the range of zoom and the varied automatic exposure modes make it as easy to get a high quality image as taking a snapshot using a small pocket camera. I later purchased a D7000 and gave this to my daughter-in-law and she has loved it as well.
customer_reviews.author: L. payne

customer_reviews.title: My first Nikon, and what a beauty!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Minolta cameras most of my life, transitioning to Sony when the bought the brand. The switch to Nikon was not made lightly, but the overwhelming number of lenses available along with the reputation won me over. I have to say it is a terrific product. Built very well, works flawlessly. I now have more camera than I can handle - well, I guess that is to say a camera I look forward to growing into. I have no technical info for you - no doubt there is plenty of that information available. This is a wonderful purchase and one that will provide years of enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: The49er

customer_reviews.title: in Like new condition
customer_reviews.text: I bought a used one from Green Earth Value, in Like new condition. Their description of the product was accurate. Delivery was 1 day ealier, which was a nice surprise. It shows little sign of used, only a few scratches on the LCD screen (which are no probs at all, as it doesnot affect the pictures), the lens is clean and functions perfectly. D90 is a nice upgrade from my current D200 (higher resolution, lighter so it is a favor to my neck, better image at high ISO). It would take sometimes to get used to the buttons and functions though.
customer_reviews.author: gtr

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera, awesome value!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is an upgrade for my D70, which I dearly love. Short and simple, this camera is awesome. the 3D focus is amazing and the ease of the controls are very intuitive. Of course if you have a D70, you have a slight learning curve since some of the buttons are in a different location (such as bracket) or button driven rather than menu driven... I was looking at the D300 and the D90, and for the price as well as features, the D90 won out. Ken Rockwell gave high marks for the D90 as well, which helped my decision. You won't be disappointed with this camera!
customer_reviews.author: K. Stigler

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: Several year old 12 megapixel camera. Has all the features most of us will ever need. Great size and solid feel. I paid less than $200 for a model in great shape with 10,000 shutter activations
customer_reviews.author: E. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Never regret for buying D90
customer_reviews.text: Don't want to add what is already here. First of all, buy this camera instead of buying D5100 (I know the picture quality is better in D5100 due to improved sensor as of D7000) for same price. The control and bottoms are very handy and I am able to get good quality photo faster than D5000 or D5100. The motor in camera enables you to use autofocus feature in old lens. If you have money, go for D7000 which does everything as of D90, but produce better quality photo with some more control in camera (customize mode, two cards). If you don't have money, go for D3100.
customer_reviews.author: sanjay

customer_reviews.title: The right decision for me.
customer_reviews.text: After almost a year of research and soul searching I finally jumped in and purchased the D90. It was the right decision for me because it allows for great photography in auto mode while I learn and gives me room to grow as I expand my photography skills. I waffled between the D60 and D90 for months and the decision came down to the D90s ability to work with an expanded lens selection. In making this decision I connected with a few friends also looking to buy D-SLRs. We all ended up making different decisions based on our individual needs. For me, the extra capabilities of the D90 were well worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: K M

customer_reviews.title: it was the best DSLR for non-professionals
customer_reviews.text: At one point, it was the best DSLR for non-professionals. It just feels right, takes great pictures and videos without breaking the bank. An all-around great camera period. After 5 years, it continues to be a capable camera for any photographer. For detailed specs, you can google it, but for the price, it is a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: On the Fence ReviewTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: superb camera
customer_reviews.text: I just replaced my D70 with the D90. I decided to save the $350 and get this over the new D7000. I saw nothing in the D7000 that would improve the picture quality over this camera. So far, the D90 is great. It is made for a photographer, and the controls are well laid out and easy to access. The picture quality is exceptional. If you are thinking of getting this or the D7000, compare features carefully. I don't think the average prosumer photographer can go wrong with the D90.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Ventura

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my D90
customer_reviews.text: After the dismal failure of the piece of crap D7000 I bought and returned  I decided to take a chance on the D90 and I'm glad I did. The quality of the camera is excellent, it actually FOCUSES and has good low-light ISO capabilities without excessive noise but with excellent detail.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian SB

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my D90
customer_reviews.text: I was torn between getting a D300 and a D90 but after thinking about it thoroughly, why would I want to buy a camera that came out a couple of years ago and costs $400 more? I upgraded to the D90 from my D40 because I wanted the sub-command dial as well as the extra features with the D90 (commander mode, bracketing, ability to use non AF-S lenses...). I love the camera and with the extra money I saved I was able to get two lenses and a battery grip all for less than for the D300 body and grip. Great camera!
customer_reviews.author: rpac78

customer_reviews.title: Top of Its Class!
customer_reviews.text: As a 35-year veteran user of Nikon SLR's, I find the D90 represents the top of its pack. The only suggestion for improvement is this: the Program Mode gives more weight to shutter speed, rather than aperture, at higher focal lengths with my non-VR Nikon zoom. Net result is I fool with the main command dial more, i.e. flexible Program Mode, to attain smaller apertures. So I retreat frequently to Aperture-Priority mode when focal length approaches 200mm. Not a problem--I simply have nothing else to complain about. I can think of no deficiencies or shortcomings of this fine camera, at least for the advanced amateur photographer. Buy it--you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Jon Easton

customer_reviews.title: I like it but...
customer_reviews.text: This is by far not my first nikon. I still have a d80 and another d90, I love the camera and have been shooting with Nikon for 40 years. However, I have only had this one for 9 months under fairly light use and it is malfunctioning. Shutter speed would not increase and the speed frames per second would not function at all. My other D90 sensor malfunctioned and had to be repaired as well.. this is getting old.
customer_reviews.author: kitten love

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera
customer_reviews.text: Greetings You will not go wrong with a Nikon. Idaho Ken
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth V. Bauer

customer_reviews.title: It works great. Easy to change settings
customer_reviews.text: I still have this camera. It works great. Easy to change settings.
customer_reviews.author: L. Stacie Vang

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I had this camera now for over a year and it has been one solid performer. I'm not a professional photographer and have barely scratched all the capabilities of this camera. It does have its limitations when shooting HD videos but is not a deal breaker. The D90 has more than enough features to keep even those so called professionals busy. Bottom line, you get excellent pictures and when you want to be more creative, this camera certainly grows with you as your skills improve.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but Great!
customer_reviews.text: I been using this camera for months and it works just great as I wanted it to be!
customer_reviews.author: Nichole Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely adore this camera. I've heard people complain about the video quality, but if you go into the menu and make sure it's not set to record in HD the quality is the same as any other digital camera. Beside the video, which is the last thing I considered in my purchase, every other aspect of this camera is also fantastic. The D90 offers an incredible amount of control, but is not extremely complicated to operate. It also has plenty of great options for automatic settings that take stunning pictures. It's a perfect camera for the non-professional, but serious weekend photographer (like myself).
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D90 SLR didgital
customer_reviews.text: The name speaks for itself! I anguished long and hard to drop this kind of money for a camera, but no regrets, other than I wish I would have waited 2 more weeks as Amazon dropped the price another $50. I did a lot of research and was glad I did as I decided to ditch the kit lens and add a much better lens to the body myself. I chose the 16-85MM VR lens and could not be happier. Solid quality all the way around. I just need to learn how to get the most out of a high tech piece of technology. Next addition to the package will be the 70-300mm VR, which will happen this week.
customer_reviews.author: Nortony

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera.
customer_reviews.text: I started out learning about photography on a Nikon D40, and was ready for an upgrade so I chose the Nikon D90. I love everything about this camera. The colors are awesome and you have a lot of control over the camera. I also like the fact that I can use bracketing and older lenses because the motor is in the body of the camera unlike the D40 and some of the newer entry level DSLRs. Now my lens purchases don't have to break my piggy bank!
customer_reviews.author: craz3z

customer_reviews.title: I love.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed. I wanted an upgrade from my D50 with more megapixels and a better stock lens. The VR 18-105mm is wonderful. It's an excellent mid-zoom lens for when you don't exactly need your telephoto. Perfect for people who are looking for an upgrade with not too many drastic changes but also want more specs. The video is a cool feature that I never thought I would need-little did I know.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Avrit

customer_reviews.title: The perfect camera?
customer_reviews.text: Just wow. This is my second Nikon DSLR and a big step up from my fine D-70s. The D-90 is about the same size and weight which is important if you're holding this camera throughout a busy day. The focus is fast and accurate in most cases. The d-lighting is a nice feature for compressing highly dynamic lighting. Shooting 4.5 frames per second is wonderful. The rear screen is sharp and bright. The ability to shoot 720P video is nice but is limited by a lack of automatic focus. The resulting video is very sharp as the DSLR's lens are bigger than anything short of a professional video camera. Nice for an occasional video but not a full replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C.

customer_reviews.title: Had This For Years
customer_reviews.text: Have used this camera for years. Very reliable and a good workhorse.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Chapman

customer_reviews.title: LOVE my D90...
customer_reviews.text: I got my D90 about a month ago.. I am loving it. Since i upgraded from the D60, I have some new features to learn. I am loveing the 11 point focus points. I have not played with the video aspect since i really dont care about that. The camera has not disappointed me at all. It is all i expected and MORE. I did not get the kit lens that came with the camera since i had other lenses already. The one that stays on the camera the most is my 35mm 1.8. They have become best of friends.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: D90 still going strong
customer_reviews.text: Five Years later and still going strong. I even have the same battery. Photos are great. Im actually pretty happy with the video this outputs too. My daughters newer Canon has a bit better HD quality and focus. But I use a nice 1.8 prime lens that does some very nice low light work. I've thought about getting another newer camera body. But Im happy with this still.
customer_reviews.author: ART- MUSIC-LOVE

customer_reviews.title: Surfing website web-master and professional programmer.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is just plain awesome. Unless you use a camera all day, every day and need the extra toughness that a metal body might give you, this thing will probably handle any possible photographic situation you would encounter. It has adjustments for just about everything, yet takes a real fine shot by just setting it to AUTO right out of the box. Read the review by KenRockwell.com on the D90 (Google will find it for you) before you plunk down twice as much money for a D300. See some sample shots at the following link: [...] Just cut and paste the entire line into your brower address line at the top of your screen.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Cruden

customer_reviews.title: A real gem.
customer_reviews.text: This camera was hardly used, it's in excellent condition, i am very , very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: maestro

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: I have my D90 for a couple of months now and I am happy with it. I think it is the last non full frame I buy. Those camera are great, but as far as big printing and high quality goes, there are limitations. Still, it is a fun camera to play with, the video works fine, even if it isnt best to zoom in and out by hand as you film... It will be a great second camera.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera, great vendor
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a Nikon D70; this is a significantly better camera with many, many improved functions and capabilities. It's also much easier to download pictures from the camera to the computer as the computer recognized the D90 as a folder which allows drag and drop. Pictures are wonderful. Vendor was fast and efficient
customer_reviews.author: steve whitney

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.text: I am new to photography but this camera is making it easy to learn!! I studied for months which camera to buy, I wanted one that would allow me to be a beginner but after reading more books and websites about photography, also allow me to take more control. I LOVE IT!! The pictures are professional quality, in my opinion, and I get so many compliments on what I've taken. I would highly recommend this camera for any beginner like me.
customer_reviews.author: CalicoSelina

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D 90...better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera, arrived promptly, and clean and perfect..just as described. Takes fabulous pictures....could not be happier with it. Every professional I ever spoke with who is a Nikon fan....recommended this D90...as a solid investment. I'm not an expert just like to take good quality photos
customer_reviews.author: Richard Barnhart

customer_reviews.title: all time great camera!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this with a 18-200mm VR II nikkor (4/5 stars for that BTW)and have not been disappointed in the least! For a DSLR, it has pretty easy controls. Once you familiarize yourself with the camera and the features you are good to go. Switching between modes and changing settings is a breeze. Pretty good retouch features too..
customer_reviews.author: Tathagatha

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write reviews, but this product was just awesome. I was very skeptical at the beginning because I read other reviews saying that the camera would get error messages when attaching the lens to the body, but I still ended up buying the product. I've had my Nikon D90 for about 4 months now and haven't had any problems at all. I've also taken at least 1000 shots already.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Wu

customer_reviews.title: and works best on the P (program) setting
customer_reviews.text: This was probably the first DSLR to shoot movies. Mono sound and could not change focus mid-stream. But it pushed the boundaries. The built-in flash is often insufficient, and works best on the P (program) setting, which also provides for fill-in flash. I coupled this with an 18-200 mm lens.
customer_reviews.author: Enigmatic Techie

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a great camera. It has a little bit of everything in it. What I mean by that is that you could do portraits, or landscape of sports with it. Although it may not be the best, it can manage to get the job done. This a great camera for beginners and mid-level photographers. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Korey Higa

customer_reviews.title: Our family of photographers LOVE it!  :)
customer_reviews.text: Oh my god! Who wouldn't LOVE this camera??!? It's amazing. It's been said over and over again by so many reviewers on so many websites. Anyone who disagrees is either a plant from another company, trying to pull a scam, or got a RARE lemon. If I had the money, I'd buy one for everyone in my family! :) (a family of photographers, I might add)
customer_reviews.author: Joanna A.

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend it any time
customer_reviews.text: My workhorse for photography. I would recommend it any time. I lost my first one in Thailand at a pond and went through Thailand with half a camera. It was working on and off. It was painful to say the least. All the beauty and have a half camera.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Alie

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D90 to replace D70
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the D90 to replace a D70. The primary features that were desired was greater ISO rating, larger playback LCD display and in camera image management and review. I found all of these features to be a significant improvement for photo shooting events. I was also pleased with a number of the improvements in the on camera button control features. They were more intuitive and functionally placed for ease of the photographer. Overall it was very similar to the D70 so the learning curve was greatly accelerated. Have used on two major events that I really was greatly a benefit to shoot with the D90.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas Camera 2001

customer_reviews.title: NIKON!
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera! Bought this camera refurbrished from BLINQ. Came in an unoriginal box but everything was there & everthing worked perfectly fine! Camera is still going stong. pictures are clean I am very satisfied with my camera!
customer_reviews.author: Crisanto

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: i have had this camera almost 2 years and it has been very good to me. recently added the d800 to my collection but still keep this one on hand for an extra body. over 27,000 actuations with the shutter and still going stong as it is rated til 90,000 i believe. only wear and tear showing is the rubber grip on the back is peeling off.
customer_reviews.author: Peter S

customer_reviews.title: Great SLR!
customer_reviews.text: This is our 1st SLR & was recommended to us by a friend. The picture quality is outstanding. Since we are new to photography, we like that the auto and pre-selected settings produce awesome pictures, without much thought put into them. We can also hand the camera off to someone who's never used it, and they will take a great photo as well. The lens that came with the camera is very versatile. The camera fits very nicely into your hand. We also like the piece that protects the LCD on the back. We've had the camera about a month and have taken hundreds and hundreds of high-quality photos! Highly recommened SLR, even for beginners!
customer_reviews.author: J. McCray

customer_reviews.title: Coooooooooooool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to give my D80 a rest or to have my D80 as a back up. I don't regret this purchase. It does what I want it to do and I like small dslr cameras (I am a traveling professional). I have other DSLR cameras but I usually use these even with weddings (weight reasons and size). It's better for mobility and endurance.
customer_reviews.author: GCPhotographers

customer_reviews.title: Great intermediate camera
customer_reviews.text: If you're not technologically inclined I wouldn't suggest buying this camera. It has a mind boggling amount of features. However, if you are into teaching yourself new things, this is a great buy! The quality of photos that can be taken with this camera are simply amazing! So, for the intermediate photographer I would say go ahead, treat yourself to a nice camera.
customer_reviews.author: EJWTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Video No Good
customer_reviews.text: By now everyone knows this camera takes marvelous photographs and not too good video. So if you want a camera with 5 year ago technology at less than half the price, this camera is for you. If you want great video, get ready to pay for newer technology.
customer_reviews.author: MacWallace

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Love It !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best decision I have made in a long time. I had a Nikon D60 (which was a nice camera) but not nearly as customizable as this one. This camera is fast, affordable, & the quality would compare to the best. Would highly recommend to anyone wanting a good prosumer camera. Very little desire left for upgrading once you own this camera. I have owned for a month now with 2500 pictures taken & ZERO problems or complaints. I don't think you would ever be sorry with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stoker

customer_reviews.title: It's a nikon
customer_reviews.text: I am a nikon snob. I currently have 3 nikon cameras. Love them all. The D90 is perfect for my needs. I love taking pictures, mostly nature, flowers, insects, lots of 90 mm macro photos. This camera works beautifully. Plenty of features, breathtaking images (with the right lenses, of course), easy to use. I paid about $750 with shipping. Wouldn't have considered another brand after owning a nikon 6006n for years. I bought this one in anticipation of our first born child. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Spooner

customer_reviews.title: this camera is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this camera. its photos are more beautiful than what i took with the nikon 5000 i replaced with this one. accepts tons of old nikon lenses and is easy to use. i am taking amazing pictures with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Environmentally Conscious Bargain Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Camera lived up to reviews and then some
customer_reviews.text: I found many reviews of the Nikon D90 before I purchased it. They said it had the features I wanted without costly extras. They were right! Excellent optics, easy to use, intuitive display, decent instruction booklet. I would highly recommend this product for amateur and semi professional photographers. Excellent quality pictures, not overly heavy, good quality for the money.
customer_reviews.author: M. C. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Exccellent Digital SLR Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first jump from a point and shoot to a digital SLR camera. I'm still learning how to use, but even using it on auto settings produces clear, crisp, beautiful pictures. It makes taking pictures fun! It is a little bulky and heavy so I reserve it for special occasions. My only complaint is that it's not very user friendly for a novice photog as myself. However, if you're more knowledgable in photo taking, then this is the camera for you. I've ordered the Nikon D90 for Dummies to hopefully improve my photo taking skills.
customer_reviews.author: Emily R.

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after thousands of photos. Been using ...
customer_reviews.text: Still going strong after thousands of photos. Been using NIKON cameras since I bought my first Nikon F (old film style) in the early 1980s.
customer_reviews.author: Racer Z

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful gift.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sister and I wanted to keep it so bad. I've always used the D90 but decided to upgrade. Arrived quickly, packed safely and couldn't ask for a better camera
customer_reviews.author: Carol Givens

customer_reviews.title: Nikon quality, clarity and ease of use. The ...
customer_reviews.text: Nikon quality, clarity and ease of use. The pictures are professional quality and the camera really does all the calculating work for you automatically. Nuff Said!
customer_reviews.author: nplazio

customer_reviews.title: dont buy
customer_reviews.text: it wasnt that good. there are better cameras on the market cheaper than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D 90
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Nikon digital cameras for over 10 years. I just upgraded from the D70 and find this a joy to use. The large LCD gives excellent results of the just captured image. The top buttons allow access to most of the needed adjustments. I have the 18-200MM lens and have not tried the included lens yet, but every photo is excellent. I have used it with my Nikon SB 600 flash and the TTl metering is on target. The built in flash also does a good job. Focus assist works well. Overall a great camera with limitless possibilities.
customer_reviews.author: G. Speck

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D90 Digital SLR
customer_reviews.text: There is not much else I can add to the many reviews already out there regarding this truly excellent camera. It takes incredible pictures, it is super sharp, fast 4.5 fps, 720 HD video mode, NIKON build and quality, Excellent display, very flexible platform. This camera will get as detailed and as manual control as you want and also do fully automatic as well. I love it and am extremely happy with it. Get the camera you won't be sorry. This camera is so much more advanced and beyond my old Nikon D50 DSLR I hardly shoot it anymore. You want it, you know it, just buy it, you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: D. V. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Great camera & lens combo!
customer_reviews.text: Spent two weeks in China and Singapore (Jan 2011) and took 1200 pix. Only needed the 18-105 lens which took close up, portrait, telephoto, action and night shots. My pictures turned out great just using the auto mode and point and shoot. Could not believe how well the night shots turned out using only ambient light. The D90 worked just fine in sub freezing temps and also the tropical moisture of Singapore. The auto mode allowed me to concentrate on composition and not worry about the settings. You cannot go wrong with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Van Cleave MD

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome camera. I have put it through a lot (rain, sand, cold, hot, etc.) It eventually started acting up, and I ordered another one for my wife to use and learn on. Very nice camera, awesome to break into pro work with.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Essmaker

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, great price
customer_reviews.text: There are plenty newer camera bodies out there, like 5100 or possibly 5200 soon. But at the time this was a good choice and a very good camera. I am thinking about getting FX at some point (d800 is too much for me) but this was/is a very camera for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jin Champloo

customer_reviews.title: No brainer, same internals as a more expensive camera with more functions and lighter weight!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic camera as a primary or a backup. It takes great pictures with speed and consistency. It looks good and works good. What more can you ask for. I have blown up images from my d90 and nikon 18-200 lense combo to over 3 feet wide for some canvas wraps and they look fantastic. It is a great buy. I saw a lot of people bad mouthing the video but I think it works great. My only issue is that it limits yo to 5 minutes at a time. I have used several lenses in manual mode and it works great! if you can use manual focus at all you can use the video.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lilly

customer_reviews.title: Fast!
customer_reviews.text: I received the camera just a few days after placing the order instead of the several weeks I was expecting! It was in excellent condition and works perfectly. I have another D90 and wanted a backup. This fits the bill and I am 100% pleased with both the camera and the service.
customer_reviews.author: always striving

customer_reviews.title: Kit lens is cheap
customer_reviews.text: The camera performs as expected. The kit lens is really a cheap one. The mounting ring of the lens is made of plastic. That plastic ring was very fragile and can be easily damaged, leaving the whole lens unusable. That happened to mine. I could not but buy a new lens. But later, I found that you could buy a mounting ring from network for about $10. I purchased the ring, used it to replace the one on that kit lens, all was fine now. The new lens I purchased was returned.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wang

customer_reviews.title: Err Message
customer_reviews.text: Nikon Err message keeps popping up even after it was sent in for repair. It would pop up during the most inopportune time, like in the middle of my daughter's dance recital or son's graduation. The sad part is that Nikon won't repair this for free even after it was sent in for an expensive repair a few months earlier. Very frustrating!!!
customer_reviews.author: Phuong

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera, Decent Kit Lens
customer_reviews.text: The D90 is a great camera that will be appreciated by both amateurs and semi-professionals. The kit lens is decent for most purposes, but doesn't do the camera's capabilities justice. I recommend purchasing the D90 body and another lens (either the 18 - 200 or 16 - 85 & 70 - 300) -D Blotterman.com
customer_reviews.author: D. Kinney

customer_reviews.title: video on a D90
customer_reviews.text: Those people complaining that an entire video program cannot be shot on the D90 are missing the point. The real breakthrough for professionals is that this still camera can be used, simply and cheaply, as a second video camera just for special scenes---fires, explosions, car crashes, crucial points in sports events, etc. You can have simultaneous coverage of very short scenes with one wide angle and one tight angle! This saves renting a second video camera with tripod, accessories, etc. And the 720x1280 frames cut in perfectly to any 720P footage you are shooting with the main camera.
customer_reviews.author: John Korty

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera - Espectacular Cámara
customer_reviews.text: It is a great camera with excellent features and the typical Nikon quality. It has multiple functions, simple and advanced, which makes it the perfect camera for both beginners photographers and amateur-advanced photographers. Highly recommended! Es una gran cámara, con excelentes prestaciones y con la calidad típica de Nikon. Tiene multiplicidad de funciones -sencillas y avanzadas-, las cuales la hacen la cámara perfecta para tanto para fotógrafos principiantes como para aquellos aficionados avanzados. Recomendada plenamente!
customer_reviews.author: C. Alejandro U.

customer_reviews.title: D90 is great
customer_reviews.text: Thought about waiting for the new Nikon's to come out, but the price dropped to $750 and couldn't resist. Glad I didn't. Had the D70 for 6 years now, but needed an upgrade. Twice the camera for 1/2 the price we paid for the D70. Can't beat it. HD movie mode is great, even the sound. Yeah AF would be nice in movie mode, but you can still manually focus on subjects just fine. All in all, great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: It's all true
customer_reviews.text: I had recently attended a Photography Exhibition in NYC and was in the market for a camera upgrade. The Nikon counter was alive with action and it took quite a while for me to be able to speak to a representative. While waiting I interviewed the customers on their opinion of the D90. After hearing nothing but raves I took the plunge. Everything that you have heard is true. All the camera that you will need for a very long time. Take the plunge. You deserve it.
customer_reviews.author: Piggoh

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations
customer_reviews.text: This camera exceeded all my expectations. Purchased after reading several favorable reviews by respected authorities. I have owned professional 35 MM film cameras in the past (Nikon) and several digital cameras recently (Sony and Canon)but this camera just blows them away. Even taking "snap shot" pictures exceeds the capabilities of the 35 MM film cameras using the best techniques under the best conditions. I also found the menu and user interface to be both convenient and intuitive. Great camera for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Forest Majors

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for a serious amateur.
customer_reviews.text: I love the camera. Easy transition/upgrade from the D70. Playing with the zoom with 12meg pixel is just too much fun. I am not familiar with the video usage yet. But so far, I think I prefer using my Sony handycam....the handycam feels like it is ergonomically friendlier.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Kwong

customer_reviews.title: Great for the semi-pro
customer_reviews.text: I have a D40 and a D60 and was about to purchase a D5000, but after looking at all the reviews I could find of each model, I chose to add the D90 to my collection...so glad I did. The quality is great for the price, and the pictures are amazing. I have added a wide angle (11-18) lens and I am so impressed with the results. I belong to a retro Thunderbird club, and getting 70 T-Birds in a clear concise photo was a major concern. Even large prints of the pics I took are of poster quality...which means, blown up, much detail can be seen. Great camera!
customer_reviews.author: Happy and Retired

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to retire my d70s and I'm glad I chose the d90! I can't add anything new to the reviews because there are so many excellent ones, I just wanted to add my 5 star rating to the pool. Superb camera!!
customer_reviews.author: LRae

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D90 body
customer_reviews.text: This is a real workhorse. I purchased this body to replace one that had started to function erratically after I had used it to shoot over 130,000 images (under very hostile environmental conditions).
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera. very good pictures and have a great deal of settings. I upgraded from D3100 and really feel the change and improvement in picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: Madhu N

customer_reviews.title: The most user friendly slr out there
customer_reviews.text: This is truly a photographer's camera, easy access of dial and buttons to avoid any delay in shooting. Picture quality is great for this level of SLR. Once you have the D90, it's going hard to switch to a different SLR. The only con is the lens, I had a few error message when I first started shooting, and later found out it is actually the plstic mount of the lens that cause the error. However the problem soon resolved shortly after the first 200 shots. So if you're looking for a more portable or metal mount lens, it'll be best to purchase the body. Besides that little problem with lens, this camera is truly a genius design.
customer_reviews.author: Laina

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional camera
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional camera, great price. I have taken thousands of pictures with this camera and has work very well for me. I also have a 50 - 300 mm lens that has enabled me to take the kind of photographs I have always wanted to take. I am very pleased with this product and would reccommed it to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kyssarya

customer_reviews.title: amazing camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional photographer and have used the D-80 and the D-3 at work. This D-90 incorporates many of the features of both as well as some from the D-300. It may not have the "full" chip, but I have not found that to be a problem. The size and weight of the camera is perfect for good photos. Some of those small ultralite cameras are hard to hold steady. The preview feature of the big screen is great. I opted for the extra grip that holds a second battery so it extends the time between recharging. It's a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: MykolG,

customer_reviews.title: Simply exceptional camera
customer_reviews.text: I am a novice in photography and after investigating enough in diferent sites, I decided bought the D90; although apparently is a model of the 2008, Is a very complete camera for novices as I. You cannot disappoint with this purchase; since the moment that begin to investigate all the functions, give you account that is very easy to know it and to learn; add a reading minutes pair of its manual and already can begin to use it in other different ways to the "Auto" with surprising results. In terms of image quality, is excellent: quantity of details and precision of the color.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: versatile, capable, typical Nikon quality camera
customer_reviews.text: very versatile with excellent photo quality from superb Nikon lens and 12 MP resolution. Ability to take 5 minute video is a real plus. Degree of customization options is very great. This camera will do anything you need.
customer_reviews.author: Callsign: Ratslugger

customer_reviews.title: A good photographer just needs to SEE, but the D90 really helps
customer_reviews.text: I have read everywhere that the D90 was the best camera - it is. You can do great pictures in auto but the really cool stuff is in tweaking the manual controls. This camera is so smart that most of the settings just need to be set to auto and it will help you get a better picture - not by helping you compose - that is still all you - but by reducing the number of "bad" pictures due to bad settings. I am extremely happy with the D90. The lens that comes in the kit is good for everyday use, but I wish now I just got the D90 body and the 18-200VR lens instead.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Zamora

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: Has become my “old faithful”. I have learned so much with this old friend and especially pleased with the in-camera AF which allows me to use old lenses
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon P.

customer_reviews.title: LOVEEE loveee loveeee
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. It's my Christmas gift to myself. I bought it used, very good from the company in Japan and it looks brand new, no scratches on it. Im just exstatic.
customer_reviews.author: Jannie

customer_reviews.title: Excelent camera
customer_reviews.text: If you want a excelent camera buy the d90, its similar to d300, the images quality its the same or better than d300 and the same sensor. This camera brings excelent shots on poor light conditions, at iso 3200 the noise control its excelent. Good value for the price. the only disadvantage its a video, this hasn't AF on video mode.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Moreira Soto

product_meta.title: Nikon D90 DX-Format CMOS DSLR Camera (Body Only) (OLD MODEL)
product_meta.description:
Style:Body Only| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingFusing 12.3-megapixel image quality inherited from the award-winning D300 with groundbreaking features, the D90’s breathtaking, low-noise image quality is further advanced with EXPEED image processing. Split-second shutter response and continuous shooting at up to 4.5 frames-per-second provide the power to capture fast action and precise moments perfectly, while Nikon’s exclusive Scene Recognition System contributes to faster 11-area autofocus performance, finer white balance detection and more. The D90 delivers the control passionate photographers demand, utilizing comprehensive exposure functions and the intelligence of 3D Color Matrix Metering II. Stunning results come to life on a 3-inch 920,000-dot color LCD monitor, providing accurate image review, Live View composition and brilliant playback of the D90’s cinematic-quality 24-fps HD D-Movie mode.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


Fusing 12.3-megapixel image quality inherited from the award-winning D300 with groundbreaking features, the D90's breathtaking, low-noise image quality is further advanced with EXPEED image processing. Split-second shutter response and continuous shooting at up to 4.5 frames-per-second provide the power to capture fast action and precise moments perfectly, while Nikon's exclusive Scene Recognition System contributes to faster 11-area autofocus performance, finer white balance detection and more. 




The D90 delivers the control passionate photographers demand, utilizing comprehensive exposure functions and the intelligence of 3D Color Matrix Metering II. Stunning results come to life on a 3-inch 920,000-dot color LCD monitor, providing accurate image review, Live View composition and brilliant playback of the D90's cinematic-quality 24-fps HD D-Movie mode. 

Nikon D90 DX Digital SLR Highlights 

Nikon Digital SLR image quality

The D90 incorporates a newly developed DX-format CMOS image sensor with technology directly inherited from the D300, Nikon's DX-format flagship. With its 12.3 effective megapixels and extraordinarily high signal-to-noise ratio, the D90 delivers low-noise images with detail and tonal gradation beyond your expectations, while Nikon's Integrated Dust Reduction System works to free image-degrading dust particles from the sensor's optical low-pass filter. 





Nikon's comprehensive EXPEED technology is engineered to make the most of the sensor's rich, 12.3-megapixel data. The result--color, detail and high-speed processing inspired by the groundbreaking D300. The D90's image-processing engine produces high-resolution pictures at remarkable speeds, better enabling high-speed continuous shooting. EXPEED also contributes to the outstanding performance of other powerful features, including Live View and the new Face Detection System. 

The D90 captures up to 4.5 images per second. Accurate 11-point autofocus is now even faster and more intelligent, aided by Nikon's exclusive Scene Recognition System. The unique Nikon 420-pixel 3D Color Matrix II Metering system, now enhanced by EXPEED image processing technologies, delivers extraordinary exposure accuracy -- immediately evident when reviewing images on the D90's super-density 3-inch 920,000-dot color LCD monitor. 

New D-Movie Mode Features 720p HD cinematic quality
A new idea for D-SLRs, the D90 offers a movie function, allowing you to shoot movies in three different motion JPEG formats: 320 x 216 pixels, 640 x 424 pixels and 1,280 x 720 pixels. Now you can capture life's moving moments with added drama by using many of Nikon's NIKKOR lenses, including the AF DX Fisheye 10.5mm f/2.8G ED and the Micro-NIKKOR lenses. The shallow depth of field can give your movies a more creative and emotional impact. An additional benefit is the D90 image sensor, which is much larger than a typical camcorder for higher image quality and exceptional high ISO performance during low-light shooting. 

Continuous shooting as fast as 4.5 frames-per-second
The D90 captures crucial moments thanks to its impressive 0.15-second start-up time, 65-millisecond shutter-release time lag (CIPA standard) and ability to shoot at 4.5 frames a second for up to 100 shots*. 

Low noise ISO sensitivity from 200 to 3200
The D90 gives you the freedom to shoot in a remarkably wide variety of lighting conditions, including dimly lit scenes, without worrying about image-degrading noise. ISO can be raised as high as Hi 1 (ISO 6400 equivalent) or lowered to Lo 1 (ISO 100 equivalent). 

3-inch super-density 920,000-dot color LCD monitor
The D90's 3-in., approx. 920k-dot LCD monitor provides unprecedented quality of image display. A wide 170-degree viewing angle makes it easy to confirm focus after shooting or during Live View. 

Built-in image sensor cleaning
Effective 4-frequency, ultrasonic sensor cleaning frees image degrading dust particles from the sensor's optical low pass filter. 

11-point AF system with Face Priority
Thanks to Multi-CAM 1000 autofocus module, the D90's 11-point AF system has fast and precise autofocus coverage across the frame with the most sensitive AF sensor operating from the center. 

In addition, the D90 has versatile AF-area modes to handle most shooting situations. The center focus point can be switched from normal to wide according to the movement of the subject. 

One-button Live View
With the D90's Live View function, you can shoot effectively without looking through the viewfinder. Simply press dedicated Live View button for instant access. Three contrast-detect AF modes let you focus on any point in the frame. 



Nikon 3D Color Matrix Metering II with Scene Recognition System
Nikon's renowned 420-pixel RGB 3D Color Matrix Metering II, teamed with the exclusive Scene Recognition System, evaluates images, referencing an on-board database of over 30,000 photographic scenes, for unmatched exposure accuracy. 


Advance Scene Modes
When you're not sure which camera settings are appropriate, simply rely on the Advanced Scene Modes. Just turn the mode dial to the appropriate icon: Portrait, Landscape, Close-up, Sports or Night Portrait. Unlike traditional scene modes, the D90 will automatically optimize the exposure, image processing, Active D-Lighting, and Picture Control to get the most out of your subject matter. What's more, the D90 has exceptional low-noise performance and accurately adjusts the camera settings whether VR (Vibration Reduction) is activated or not, so you can expect beautiful, crisp images, even in many low-light scenes. 

Auto Active D-Lighting
Details in the shadows and highlighted areas of your photos are often lost when strong lighting increases the contrast between the bright and dark areas of your image. Nikon's unique Active D-Lighting technology accurately restores these important details by localizing tone control while you shoot. Choose from four levels, including the new Extra High. Active D-Lighting can be used manually or set to Auto mode. It is also possible to bracket your pictures to get one with Active D-Lighting and one without. 

Durable, high-precision shutter
Reliability is not a luxury--it's a necessity. That's why Nikon subjected numerous D90 shutter mechanisms to grueling 100,000-cycle shutter-release tests with the unit fully assembled in the camera. 

Built-in, Pop-up Flash
The D90 is equipped with Nikon's i-TTL flash control, renowned for consistently accurate and balanced flash exposures. The built-in flash has an 18mm lens coverage and works as a wireless commander, controlling up to two independent groups of an unlimited number of remote Speedlights and providing incredible creative lighting control--on location or in the studio. 

In-camera image editing
Creative freedom stems from exclusive in-camera image editing, featuring Fisheye effect, Straighten and Distortion Control as well as D-Lighting, Red-eye Reduction, Image Overlay, Monochrome and more. 

HDMI Compatible
You can enjoy both still images and movies shot with the D90 via HDMI (High-Definition Multimedia Interface) with the global-standard digital A/V signal transfer. HDMI Mini connector is employed. 

GPS geo-tagging
The optional GP-1 GPS unit provides automatic real-time geo-tagging.

What’s in the box: Nikon D90 SLR Digital Camera (Body Only), EN-EL3e Rechargeable Lithium-ion Battery, MH-18a Quick Charger, UC-E4 USB Cable, EG-D2 Audio/Video Cable, AN-DC1 Neck Strap, BM-10 LCD Monitor Cover, BF-1A Body Cap, DK-5 Eyepiece Cap, DK-21 Rubber Eyecup, BS-1 Accessory Shoe Cap, Nikon Software Suite CD-ROM, User Guides and 1-Year Nikon U.S.A. Warranty.



REVIEW FROM DPREVIEW.COM




Learn more about this camera
at DPReview.com Nikon D90 Digital SLR: Highly recommended by dpreview.com 

Almost exactly two years after the D80 was announced comes its replacement, the rather predictably named D90. The D80 has been one of Nikon's quiet successes, and even today, despite being positively Methuselah-like in digital camera terms it continues to sell and often makes its way into our top 10 most clicked on cameras. Because it looks so similar to the D80 the D90 appears at first glance to be one of those rather subdued incremental upgrades, but dig a little deeper and you'll find there's plenty to keep Nikon fans happy. 

First and foremost there's a new CMOS sensor, which Nikon claim produces D300 quality output at up to ISO 6400 and - one of several features to 'trickle down' from higher models - the same highly acclaimed 3.0-inch VGA screen as the D3/D300. Naturally it has Live View with contrast-detect AF and it would have been surprising had it not sported some form of dust removal system. More surprising is the inclusion of the world's first DSLR movie mode (720p HDTV quality, no less) and HDMI output, though as we'll see later it does come with some limitations. A lot of the core photographic spec is the same as or very similar to the D80, though there is a new shutter and an implementation of the 3D tracking AF seen on the D3/D300. 

And it's not just the high end models that have lent features and technology to the D90; the user interface has been given the same user-friendly treatment as the D60, as have the retouching options. As it was explained to us the D90 is intended to appeal to the broadest audience of any Nikon SLR, from first-time 'step up' customers moving from a compact to serious amateurs wanting comprehensive photographic control without the cost and weight of a D300. Whether the D90 is as capable as its feature set suggests, we'll see as the review unfolds. 

Nikon D90 Key Features  * 12.9-megapixel DX-format CMOS sensor (effective pixels: 12.3 million) 
 * 3.0-inch 920,000 pixel (VGA x 3 colors) TFT-LCD (same as D3 and D300) 
 * Live View with contrast-detect AF, face detection 
 * Image sensor cleaning (sensor shake) 
 * Illuminated focus points 
 * Movie capture at up to 1280 x 720 (720p) 24 fps with mono sound 
 * IS0 200-3200 range (100-6400 expanded) 
 * 4.5 frames per second continuous shooting (buffer: 7 RAW, 25 JPEG fine, 100 JPEG Normal) 
 * Expeed image processing engine 
 * 3D tracking AF (11 point) 
 * Short startup time, viewfinder blackout and shutter lag 
 * Slightly improved viewfinder (96% frame coverage) 
 * Extensive in-camera retouching including raw development and straightening 
 * Improved user interface 
 * New optional compact GPS unit (fits on hot shoe) 
 * Same battery and vertical grip as D80 
 * Vignetting control in-camera 
 * 72 thumbnail and calendar view in playback 

Nikon D90 vs D80: Key Differences 

Although it's had a bit of a design refresh with slightly sharper lines, the D90 is externally very similar to its predecessor (dimensions are identical, though it is heavier). Looking at the differences it's obviously a solid incremental upgrade rather than a total reinvention of the popular D80, with several key improvements (most importantly the sensor and screen) and a welcome smattering of must-have 2008 features (live view, dust removal). Oh yes, and of course there's that one little new feature sitting at the back of the classroom with its hand waving in the air, shouting 'Sir! Sir!'; the 'world's first' DSLR movie mode.  * 12.3 MP CMOS sensor (D80: 10.2 MP CCD) 
 * Dust removal system 
 * Bigger, better screen (as D3, D300) 
 * Live View with contrast detect AF 
 * Movie Mode 
 * Wider ISO range, upgraded AF system (3D tracking, face detection) 
 * Active D-Lighting, vignetting control and extra retouching options 
 * Automatic chromatic aberration correction 
 * Picture Control presets 
 * Faster continuous shooting and larger buffer 
 * Pictmotion slideshows 

Read more at dpreview.com 



REVIEW FROM WIRED.COM


 

Read more digital camera reviews
at Wired.com Nikon D90 Takes World Champion DSLR Title Belt 

Sometimes the mere notion of being "number two" can light a motivational fire under your keister. Look at some famous folks who, despite being considered numero dos, went on to dominate their respective fields and even eclipse their predecessors: A pupil of Socrates, Plato opted not to go the hemlock-chugging route and instead helped lay down the foundations of Western philosophy. Tom Brady was destined to be a career second banana until Drew Bledsoe's internal bleeding set him on the path to three Super Bowl wins. Jean-Luc Picard played second fiddle to Kirk only to become the greatest captain in Star Trek. Ever. (Watch TNG's season 3 finale if you don't believe me.) And in the world of DSLR cameras, Nikon has been toiling to one day escape from the shadow of a certain photo-manufacturing giant whose name rhymes with "Danon." And with its newest shooter it looks like that day may have finally come. 

Nikon's latest offering, the 12-megapixel D90 is a feature-packed fistful of photo fury that's sure to help pave your way to full-fledged Flickrati status. Straight from the box and out on the street the D90 shows off its picture-making prowess. Our testing unit came bundled with a (bordering on) superwide 18-105mm f3.5-5.6 lens that we used for all of our evaluations. 

The 11-point focusing system with the face priority speedily locks onto subjects while the automatic Active D-Lighting (a feature that optimizes details within shadows and high contrast subjects) is a noticeable step forward in on-camera illumination. The flash images show off a pleasing balance between the strobe and the ambient light even when just shooting in the full Auto and Program modes. Nikon's also got a convergence hit with the integration of a movie mode that makes three flavors of video, the yummiest being up to five minutes of 720p HD in a cinematic 16:9 aspect ratio. Owing to the size of the sensor and the higher quality optics, video clarity and depth of field are on par with the D90's stills. And when it comes to checking your work, Nikon's made it easy, loading the D90 with the same high-res 3-inch LCD found on its $5000 D3. If that's not big enough, just plug it straight into your HDTV with the built-in HDMI connection. All told this camera has scads of grin-worthy features that will continue to feed your frenzy-filled lifestyle for some time to come. That is until another camera comes along to usurp its throne. 

RATING 9 out of 10 

WIRED Enormous image sensor blows open the door to some of the finest 12.3-megapixel images we've produced yet. Nikon's top-of-the-line high-res 3-inch LCD is prettier than looking at a supermodel with beer goggles. In-camera dust reduction is spot on at removing spots from the sensor. One-touch info button and simple, descriptive help screens clarify deep, detailed menus. Toss out your camcorder; the 720p, 24 fps video capture on the D90 will trump its performance — especially in low lighting. Face facts: Face-detection system works quickly, accurately, and effortlessly. 

TIRED Only manual focus in the video mode. Seriously, this is really the only problem we had with the D90 and even that was a stretch. 

Camera Resolution 12.3 megapixels, with 15.8 x 23.6mm CMOS sensor.  * Read more digital camera reviews at Wired.com
